posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.86 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

This release includes two notable changes: a Liquid Glass redesign, and group polls!

Release notes:

  • Signal polls are here! Are you and your friends on the same page, or are you poll-ar opposites? Polls are an easy way to see what your group chat really thinks. Create a poll with competing dinner options, vacation destinations, musical preferences for an upcoming road trip, or any other important choices. Everyone in the group can vote and see each other’s responses, and you can decide whether or not to allow multiple votes.

  • This update also includes the first wave of the Liquid Glass redesign for iOS 26 and iPadOS 26 with refined animations and new visual elements. Future releases will have even more improvements, but if you’re thirsty for a new look then this Liquid Glass should already be pretty refreshing.

Liquid Glass

This is the first version of our Liquid Glass redesign, available to users on iOS 26. We’ve improved several parts of our app with a fresh coat of paint, new animations, and a lot of Liquid Glass. Give it a shot: play around with chat wallpapers, the now-dynamic message input bar, a refreshed attachment picker, and much more!

Notably, we have not yet applied the new styling to every screen in the app: for example, our calling UI, the media viewer, navigation/tabs on iPad, and in-chat banners. We plan to continue improvements in future releases!

We’re excited to finally share these features with you all, and we look forward to your feedback!

When reporting issues, please include which iOS 26 version you’re running – 26.0, 26.1, and 26.2 all had different known issues on Apple’s side.

Backups

Finally, with this release we’re continuing our TestFlight-exclusive testing of Backups. See the beta release post for 7.79 for more details.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter! When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.79 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.86.0.1173-beta

79 new commits since 7.85.0.1157-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.86 [1]

  • Uniquify usernames case-insensitively [2]

  • Reset the url session cache when the proxy changes [3]

  • Reset PIN reminder to 7 days on backup restore. [4]

  • Remove TESTABLE_BUILD gate on NSKeyedUnarchiver extension [5]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.0 [6]

  • Prompt for confirmation when backing out of backups onboarding [7]

  • Set the cell color on SignalList [8]

  • Update background on more emoji button [9] (reverted by [11])

  • Fix Send button visible on iOS 26 when recording a voice note. [10]

  • Revert "Update background on more emoji button" [11] (reverts [9])

  • Add the ability to tag requests with extra logging data [12]

  • Fix empty names in restored call links [13]

  • Update padding on backups intro view [14]

  • Set CallLink.revoked when restoring [15]

  • Fix name for restored call links [16]

  • Fix 8-minute-idle-group-call audio failure [17]

  • Build fix after merging old PR [18]

  • Nicer animations for the mentions panel. [19]

  • Improve animations in chat input bar. […] [20]

  • Show suggested stickers panel above chat input toolbar. [21]

  • Do not show disabled send button when text input is empty but there's quoted message. [22]

  • Update emoji section toolbar depending on screen size [23]

  • Restore forward sheet title [24]

  • Update more emoji button style [25]

  • Polls text boxes should grow and show a character countdown [26]

  • No-op if a StoreKit purchase is cancelled, rather than move on [27]

  • Lower proto version for poll vote & poll terminate [28]

  • Contacts in view votes pane should be tappable [29]

  • Enable poll send feature flag [30]

  • Tweak animations for suggested stickers and mentions panels. [31]

  • Use endEditing instead of resignFirstResponder [32]

  • Add variant of Link'n'Sync sheet subtitle for paid Backups [33]

  • Update conversation settings padding [34]

  • Account for safe area in chat customization views [35]

  • Expire timer for poll terminate should use data message value [36]

  • Separate download status into it's own backup settings section [37]

  • Cancel BackupsEnabled notifications when scheduling another [38]

  • Remove unused videoResolution method [39]

  • Allow interrupts when waiting for storage service [40]

  • Animate rows being added in polls [41]

  • Batch poll vote notifications [42]

  • Don't use chat list iOS 26 workaround on previous iOS versions [43]

  • Fix stickers and attachment keyboards not sized appropriately. [44]

  • Improve animations when presenting attachment and stickers keyboards. [45]

  • Add UX for "Backup subscription redeemed too many times" [46]

  • Simplify UIImage badging, remove border [47]

  • Add warning UX if local IAPSubscriberData doesn't match local IAP account [48]

  • Add warning UX to BackupSettings around Background App Refresh [49]

  • Move reenableBackupsButton into its own struct [50]

  • Only present WelcomeToBackupsSheet on first enabling [51]

  • Build fix after rebases [52]

  • Unbreak main. [53]

  • Use fixed colors for chat input bar. [54]

  • Fix layout issues with Archived Chats row. [55]

  • Convert ConversationStyle to struct. [56]

  • Improve logging in AppAttestManager [57]

  • Support canceling media restore on linked iPads [58]

  • Fix chat input bar view hierarchy and turn dynamic colors back on. […] [59]

  • Be even more aggressive when generating thumbnails [60]

  • Improve logging for BGProcessingTask runs [61]

  • Remove now-unnecessary BuildFlags [62]

  • Internally retry network errors during list-media [63]

  • Add prompt when approaching rate limit during recovery key rotation [64]

  • BuildFlags for Backups prod-beta [65]

  • Move terms & conditions link in backup plan view [66]

  • Tweak attachment panel styling for iOS 26. […] [67]

  • Fix crash when opening a chat with saved draft of one emoji. [68]

  • Larger top margin for the sticker keyboard on iOS 26. […] [69]

  • Add downgrading-BackupPlan logs [70]

  • Use .monospaced() for Chat List restore banner [71]

  • Redesign recipient pickers for iOS 26 [72]

  • Layout improvements for the PIN reminder sheet. […] [73]

  • Revert "Update to Xcode 26.1" [74]

  • Stop building with Xcode 16.4 [75]

  • Liquid Glass app icons [76]

  • Update release notes [77]

  • Update translations [78]

  • Fix loop when cleaning up view once messages [79]

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Very cool! BTW, it is possible to scroll the compose box when it is empty.

I installed the beta and backed up my data, then uninstalled and reinstalled the app. However, when I try to restore the back up and enter the recovery key I don’t get any ‘continue’ or ‘enter’ option, just the ‘no recovery key?’ link. Should it auto enter once the key is entered? I’ve tried pasting the key, and entering it manually, no change. What is the expected behavior here?

I’m currently on ios version 17.6.1, is that likely to be causing an issue?

A scroll bar appears at the bottom of the screen when opening any chat:

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Hey all, thanks for the reports so far. As a note:

When reporting issues, please include which iOS 26 version you’re running – 26.0, 26.1, and 26.2 all had different known issues on Apple’s side.

Thank you!

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: This sounds like a bug. If you’re able to provide screenshots (with your key redacted, of course) that would be very helpful.
It shows correctly for me on iOS 26.2 (forgot to add that it is beta 2).
Not for me though. I’m on iOS 26.2 beta 2

if I open a chat the upper bar (with the contact name, video call and call icon) switches to black or white font depending on the background for increased contrast (as expected) but only after a split second. Can this be calculated in the background so if I open a chat the upper bar is already calculated?

-

Buttons like the back button in the top left corner (as seen in the gif) or the date have an effect which is a bit slow, gif starts after opening the group (trying not to show my chat list)

-

Are these buttons supposed to be this large?

-

Here’s a screenshot of the screen with the recovery key entered.

IMG_7486750×866 74.7 KB

I’d like to share my personal opinion on the new Liquid Glass design: I believe the bottom bar on the Signal home screen should resemble Apple’s implementation, with the search button positioned on the bottom left. This would also allow it to blend seamlessly with all the native Apple apps and make the overall experience a bit easier for users. What’s your opinion on this?

posts.cooked:
loving the glass, and the tint on the send button! chats look gorgeous with a wallpaper now

little thing with the reaction picker: some emoji like are hard to see in light mode compared to others e.g.:

signal ios reaction picker in light mode with the following emoji visible: 😄❤️✨1124×214 15.9 KB

iOS 26.1

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.86.0/91eba4dfac0c068dc69a6c2c79d86e24b32037ddd094e93e5ea4a9042d9d5572.zip

I love the Liquid Glass redesign!

A few observations, I don’t know if these are bugs and need a debug log:

– When you long press on a poll, a menu appears that allows you to stop the poll, among other things. But when you long press at the bottom of the bubble, the option to stop the poll does not appear.

Screenshot

IMG_67421179×1907 135 KB

– When you stop a poll and then delete it for everyone, the poll bubble indicates that the “message has been deleted.” Below that, the information “You have stopped the poll [poll name]” with a link to it remains displayed. If I inadvertently put confidential information in the poll title and want it to disappear, it is impossible. I don’t know if it’s really a problem or not.

Screenshot

IMG_67431179×601 50.6 KB

– When creating a poll, when the cursor is placed in the text field of the last poll option and it is empty, if I press the Enter key on the keyboard, the keyboard disappears and then reappears immediately. Shouldn’t it remain hidden?

Anyway, thank you for this fantastic work!

(iOS 26.1, iPhone 15)

Very beautiful Liquid Glass update. Congratulations to team. I have one little suggestion about chat bubbles. I think liquid glass effects on bubbles looks very nice on iMessage. I think similar type of design on signal would serve more complete experience.

Like this:
